title: The Quartet
provenance_text:
Max Weber [1881-1961], Great Neck, NY, until 1943 [1]; Paul Rosenberg & Co., New York, NY, by March 1943 [2]; purchased by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, January 1944 [3].

Notes:
[1]. See "American Paintings and Sculpture to 1945 in the Carnegie Museum of Art," pages 473-474.
[2]. The painting was no. 33 in the Max Weber monographic exhibition at Carnegie Institute, March-April, 1943 (listed as collection of Paul Rosenberg & Co.) 
[3]. The painting was received at the museum for purchase consideration in November 1943; the invoice from Paul Rosenberg & Co is dated December 10, 1943 with payment acknowledged on December 30, 1943. The painting was accessioned on January 14, 1944.

creator.death_place: Great Neck (Nassau county, New York state, United States)
